column4: can anyone help me with difficult sound problem-no sound in ubuntu 8.04
What card?
asoundconf list should list it if it's detected
otherwise 'lspci'
asoundconf list or look through the output from "lspci"
Did anything show up from "asoundconf list" ? ( that will tell me if it is detected by alsa at all )
Ok, run "alsamixer" and make sure that all channels are turned up and unmuted
If it's muted you will see "MM" at the bottom, press 'm' to unmute / mute a channel
Do you possibly have more than one sound card?
Try going to System -> Preferences -> Sound and try the test tone with the setting set to pulseaudio and alsa
'lspci'
If lspci returned nothing something is seriously wrong
Tell me the output ( if it's only one line ) of "lspci; echo $?"
Run the command without the quotes
And you are running the command without quotes?
Does "echo test" print anything?
and "lspci ; echo $?" still prints nothing?
That frankly shouldn't be possible
What is the output of "echo $0" ?
the command "echo $?" should never return nothing, and is actually a built in function of bash so I don't know how "lspci ; echo $?" could return nothing
It can't hurt but both of those commands not working is extremely odd

run "script" it should start a new shell, all output from this shell will be saved to a file named typescript in your home folder, in this new shell run "lspci ; echo $?" then run "exit" and pasetebin the file ( typescript )
Reboot and try running memtest, if that passes try an fsck ( you may need to do it from a liveCD ) and back up any important files as soon as possible in case your drive is going
